ETYMOLOGY: From Old French consoler (to comfort, soothe), from Latin consolari (to comfort, solace), from con- (with, together) + solari (to solace, comfort).
SINCE: Late 14th century (verb); mid-18th century (noun, furniture); mid-20th century (noun, electronic device)

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To alleviate the grief, sorrow, or disappointment of someone; to give comfort to.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 安慰，慰藉；减轻（某人）的悲伤或失望。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She tried to console her friend after he received the bad news.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她试图在她朋友收到坏消息后安慰他。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A small table or cabinet designed to stand against a wall, often for decorative purposes or to hold a TV/stereo.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （靠墙的）置物架；控制台式家具；电视柜、音响柜等
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We placed a decorative lamp on the console in the hallway.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们把一盏装饰灯放在走廊的置物架上。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a game console | a video game console | a control console
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A control panel for a mechanical or electronic device; specifically, an electronic device for playing video games.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 游戏机；（计算机或机器的）控制台，操作台
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He spent the whole weekend playing on his new game console.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他整个周末都在玩他的新游戏机。
